name: Add it Up
skill: Skill Adding one- and two-digit numbers.
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Place the cards in a stack.  2. Player 1 turns over 2 cards to make a two-digit number.   	 Example:  5 and 2 make ''52''.  3. Player 2 turns over 1 card to make a one-digit number.  4. Each player then adds the numbers to find the sum (paper and/or models may be used).  5. Compare answers.  6. If both answers are correct, players win the cards.  If not, cards go back in the stack.  7. Game ends when all cards have been won.

name: Add What?
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Place the cards in a stack.  2. Player 1 draws 2 cards.  3. He/she begins with the smaller number and makes a number sentence with a missing addend.   	 Example:  He/she draws a 7 and a 2 and says, 	 ''2 plus what number equals 7?''  4. Player 2 determines what the missing number is.  5. If Player 2 is correct, he/she keeps both cards.  6. If not, Player 1 keeps the cards.  7. Players switch roles and continue until all cards are used.  8. Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

name: Big Battles (Two-Digit)
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Each player turns over two cards to make two numbers.   	 Example: 2 and 4 make ''24'' and 3 and 7 make ''37''.  2. Each player adds these 2-digit numbers to find the sum (paper may be used).  3. Compare answers.  4. If both answers are correct, players win the cards.  If not, cards go back in the stack.  5. Game ends when all cards have been won.

name: Count on it!
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Divide the deck evenly among the players.  2. Player 1 turns over a card.  3. Then Player 2 turns over a card and counts on that many.  4. If he/she is correct, Player 2 keeps both cards.  If not, Player 1 keeps the cards.  5. Next, Player 2 turns over a card first, then Player 1 turns over a card and counts on.  6. Play continues until all cards are used.  7. Player with the most cards at the end is the winner!

name: Count Up Ten
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: **Remove all ''10'' cards before play.** 1. Divide the cards evenly between the players.  2. Player 1 turns over two cards and places them together to make a two-digit number.   	 Example: Use a 9 and a 5 to make 95 or 59.  3. Player 2 then has to count up ten correctly.   	 Example: If the nubmer if 95, player counts, ''96, 97, 98, 99, 100, 101, 102, 103, 104, 105''.  4. If Player 2 counts correctly, he/she gets both cards.  If not, Player 1 gets the cards.  5. Play continues until all cards are used.  6. Player with the most cards wins.

name: Divide it Up
skill: Skill: Dividing rectangles and circles into equal-sized pieces.
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Place the cards in a pile.  2. Player 1 selects a card.  3. Both players must draw that number of rectangles and/or circles on their paper.  4. Once the shapes are drawn, Player 2 calls out ''halves'' or ''fourths''.  5. Each player mush divide each of their shapes (in halves or fourths).  6. The first player to divide all of their shapes correctly wins the card.  7. The first player with 10 cards wins!

name: Double Up
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Turn over one card.  2. The first player to ''double'' that number wins the card.   	 Example:  A 4 is turned over, the players would add 4+4 and call out 8.  3. Play continues until all cards are used.  4. Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

name: Double Up + 1
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Turn over one card.  2. The first player to ''double'' that number and add 1 wins the card.   	 Example:  A 4 is turned over, the players would add 4+4, add 1, and call out 9.  3. Play continues until all cards are used.  4. Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

name: Fact Family Fun
skill: Skill: Making Fact Families with two numbers.
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Each player flips over a card.  2. Player 1 says a number sentence using the two numbers.  3. Player 2 copyrights a different one.  4. Player 1 states a third one.  5. Player 2 states a fourth one.  6. If players succeed in stating all the fact family sentences (without helping each other), they win the round.  If not, the cards go back in the deck and the game wins the round.  7. Play is over when students have beat the game by winning all cards.

name: Fishing for Ten
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: **Remove all ''10'' cards before play.** 1. Paass out 7 cards to each player.  2. Put the other cards in a pile (pond).  3. Players try to find two numbers that make 10.  4. Player 1 asks Player 2 for a card needed to make 10.   5. If he/she does not have one, Player 1 will ''go fish'' and pull a card from the pond.  6. Any matches of 10 are set aside.  7. First player to match all his/her cards is the winner.

name: Flip Flop
skill: Skill: Using addition to help with subtraction.
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Place cards in a stack.  2. Player 1 selects two cards and sayas an addition number sentence with those cards.   	 Example:   Player has a 3 and a 6 and says, ''3 plus 6 equals 9.'' 3. Player 2 then uses that addition facto to make a subtraction fact.   	 Example:  Player would say, ''If 3 plus 6 equals 9, then 9 minus 6 equals 3.'' 4. If both players copyright their sentences correctly, they win the cards.  If not, the game wins the cards.  5. Players switch roles and continue.  6. The game ends when the players win all the cards.

name: Get a Clue!
skill: Skill: Naming and drawing attributes of shapes.
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Place cards in a stack.  2. Player 1 selects a card.  3. He/she gives that number of clues describing a certain shape (triangle, square, circle, pentagon, etc.).  4. Player 2 names and draws the shape described.  5. If Player 2 is successful, he/she gets the card.  If not, Player 1 gets the card.  6. Player 2 then selects a card and play continues.  7. The player to win 6 cards first is the winner!

name: Greedy Gator
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Divide the cards into two stacks.  2. Each player gets a stack of cards.  3. At the same time, they flip over one card (ones) and then another (tens).  4. The first player to place their fingers (peace-sign style) between the numbers for < or > correctly wins the cards IF they read the equation correctly.  5. If not, they other player automatically winds the cards.  6. Player with the most cards wins.

name: Groups of Ten
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: **Remove all ''10'' cards before play.** 1. Place  the cards in a pile.  2. Player 1 selects a card.  3. He/she then represents that number of tens with a drawing.   	 Example:   Player has a 7.  Player draws 7 tens rods, 7 circles with 10 starts in each, or 7 rows of 10 dots, etc.  4. Then Player 1 must copyright the value of their tens:  ''___ tens is ___''.   	 Example:  ''7 tens is 70.'' 5. If the player's drawing and statement are correct, he/she keeps their card.  6. If not, Player 2 gets the card.  7. The player who earns 10 cards first wins.

name: How High?
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: **Remove all ''10'' cards before play.** 1. Divide the cards evenly between the players.  2. Player 1 turns over two cards and places them together ot make a two-digit number, and Player 2 does the same.   	 Example:  Use a 4 and a 7 to make 47 or 74.  3. The player with the lower number then counts by ones until he/she reaches the other number.  4. If this player counts correctly, he/she gets all the cards.  If not, the other player gets the cards.  5. Play continues until all cards are used.  6. Player with the most cards wins.

name: How Many Units?
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: **Players will need a group of short, uniform objects to use for measuring (paperclips, cubes, etc.).** 1. Place the cards in a stack.  2. Player 1 selects a card.  3. Players search for an object in the room that measures that length of objects.   	 Example:  Player draws a 6, players look for an object that is 6 paperclips long.  4. The first player to find an object wins the card.  5. Play continues until one player has 10 cards, who is then the winner!

name: Is it Equal?
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Give each player 6 cards and place the remaining cards in a pile.  2. Player 1 selects two cards from his/her hand and lays them down.   	 Example:  A 2 and 7 are placed.  3. Player 2 looks for a combination of cards in his/her hand that EQUALS the sum of Player 1's cards.   	 Example:  To also make a sum of 9, he/she places a 1, a 2, and a 6.  4. If Player 2 is successful, he/she keeps all the cards in his/her ''winning pile.'' If not, Player 1 keeps all the cards in his/her ''winning pile.'' 5. Each player draws more cards to replace those that were played.  6. Player 2 begins the next hand and play continues until all cards are used.  7. Player with the most cards at the end wins.

name: Make it Greater
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Give each player 8 cards.  2. Place the remaining cards in a stack.  3. Player 1 selects two of his/her cards to make a two-digit number and places them on the playing surface.   	 Example:  Player chooses a 4 and a 7 to make the number 47.  4. Player 2 then looks for 2 cards in his/her hand to make into a two-digit number that is greater than Player 1's number.  5. If successful, Player 2 wins all four cards.  If not, Player 1 wins the cards.  6. Draw new cards from the pile to keep 8 cards in each players' hand.  7. Player 2 begins the next round.  8. Player with the most cards wins.

name: Mental Math with 10
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Player 1 turns over two cards to make a 2-digit number.  2. Player 1 then calls out ''Add!'' or ''Subtract!'', and Player 2 must add or subtract 10.  3. If correct, Player 2 keeps the cards.  If not, place the cards back in the pile.  4. Trade roles and repeat until all cards have been won.  5. Player with the most cards wins.

name: Operation
skill: Skill: Basic fact practice with addition and subtraction.
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: **Three players are needed.** 1. Select one person to be the Operator.   The other 2 people are the players.  2. Place all cards in a pile.  3. Player 1 turns over a card and the Operator chooses an operation and number to use.   	 Example:  Player 1 turns over a 5.  Operator says, ''Subtract 3!'' 4. The first player to correctly answer receives the card.  5. Player 2 selects the card for the next round.  6. Operator can keep or change the operation and number each round.  7. Play continues until all cards are used.  8. Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

name: Order Up!
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Place the cards in a stack.  2. Player 1 selects a card.  3. Player 2 calls out, ''Longest to shortest'' or ''Shortest to longest''.  4. Player 1 then finds that number of objects in thh room and lines them up by length as Player 2 called out.  5. If Player 1 correctly orders the objects, he/she keeps the card.  6. Play continues until one player has 10 cards, who is then the winner!

name: Organize it!
skill: Skill: Organizing data and answering questions about data.
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Place the cards in a stack.  2. Player 1 draws 8 cards and Player 2 draws 8 cards.  3. Players work together to organize all of their cards into groups (by color, by number, etc.).  4. Both players represent this data on their papers in any way they choose.  5. Once their representations are complete, players take turns asking questions about the data.  6. A point is earned for each correct answer.  7. Player with the most points after 6 wins.

name: Pattern Block Shapes
skill: Skill: Combining shapes to make other shapes.
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: **Pattern blocks or pattern block cuts are needed.** 1. Player 1 names a shape before play and flips over a card.  2. Players work together to use that number of pattern blocks to create the named shape.  3. If the players are successful, place the card in the ''winning'' pile.  4. If the players are not able to create the shape, the card goes back in the stack.  5. Player 2 then takes a turn naming the shape and drawing a card.  6. The game ends when 5 cards have been won.

name: Place Value Battle (Two-Digit)
skill: Skill: Forming the largest (or smallest) 2-digit number.
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Players sit side by side (not face to face).  2. Players take turns drawing a card and naming the ''place'' (ones or tens) it will be.  3. Cards cannot be moved once placed.  4. Players repeat until they have both formed a 2-digit number.  5. The player with the largest (or smallest, depending on the type of play) 2-digit number wins all cards.  6. Play continues until all cards are used.  7. Player with the most cards winds.

name: Tens Take Away
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Player 1 turns over two cards and calls the value of each cards' digit as if it were in the tens place.   	 Example:  An  will have the value of 80.  2. Player takes the higher value, subtracts the lower value, and calls out the difference.  3. If correct, Player 1 keeps the cards. If not, return the cards to the pile.  4. Player 2 plays in the same way, and the game continues until all cards have been won.  5. Player with the most cards wins.

name: Time's Up! (Hour and Half-Hour)
skill: Skill: Telling tiem to the nearest hour and half-hour.
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: **Paper clock needed.** 1. Player 1 turns over a card.  2. Put the hour hand on that number.  3. Then decide where the minute hand will go (on the hour or half-hour).  4. Player 2 must name the time.  5. If correct, he/she wins the card.  6. Switch roles and continue playing.  7. Play continues until one player has 10 cards.  8. That player is the winner!  **Note that on a real clock the hour hand would also be moving if the time is on the half-hour.  Practic this with your paper clock.**

name: Triple Battle
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: **Three players are needed.** 1. Divide the deck evenly between each player.  2. Each player turns over a card.  3. The first player to announce the correct sum of all 3 cards wins the cards.  4. Play continues until all cards are used.  5. Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

name: What's the Difference?
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Place the cards in a stack.  2. Each player selects one care.  3. Players will work together to tell a subtraction word problem.  4. The player with the higher card begins.   	 Example:  Players draw a 4 and a 7.  Player with the 7 begins, ''There were 7 dogs at the park.''  The other player continues, ''4 dogs went home.'' 5. The players solve the problem.  6. If both players have the same answer, they win the cards.  If not, the cards go back in the stack.  7. The game ends when players have won 3 cards total.

name: What's the Sum?
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Player 1 flips over a card and begins a story problem using that number.   	 Example:  Player 1 draws a 6 and would say, ''The farmer has 6 chickens.'' 2. Player 2 flips over a card and finishes the story using the number on the card.   	 Example:  Player 2 draws a 3 and would say, ''The farmer bought 3 more chickens.'' 3. Both players solve the math problem with an illustration (pictures, number sentence, chart, etc.).  4. If they arrive at the same answer they win the cards.   If not, the cards go back in the stack.  The game ends when players have won 3 cards total.

name: Add it!
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Each player roles one die at the same time.  2. The first person to say the sum of the two dice gets a point.  3. The first player to ten wins!  4. For a challenge, each player could roll two dice.

name: Even/Odd
skill: Skill: Addition, identifying even and odd.
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Play with a partner.  2. One person is even and the other is odd.  3. Take turns rolling 2 (or 3) dice.  4. Add the dice togetehr and decide if the sum is odd or even.  5. Players receive a point depending whether the sum is odd or even.  6. The first player to get to 20 points wins.

name: Find the Neighbor
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Roll one or two dice and tell someone the numbers that come before or after.  2. For a challenge, tell someone the numbers are 5 more, 5 less, 10 more, 10 less, etc.

name: Get to Zero!
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Each player starts with a score of 20.  2. On their turn, roll one die and subtract that number from 20.  3. Continue until one player gets to zero and wins!

name: Penny Pick Up
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Collect 100 pennies and place them on the surface where you will play the game.  2. Using one die, players take turns rolling the die and picking-up the corresponding number of pennies, according to the number rolled.  3. To pick-up the last remaining pennies the number rolled must match the remaining pennies exactly.  4. When all of the pennies have been picked-up, the player who has collected the most pennies wins.

name: Pig!
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Each player rolls one die on their turn.  2. For each roll you get the number of points the die shoes.  3. However, if you roll a 1, your turn ends and you score no more points.  4. After each roll, you can choose to roll again or hold.  5. The winner is the first player to reach 100 (or any chosen number)

name: Subtract it!
copyright: Copyrighted by Teacher's Clubhouse, Inc. (2014) www.teachersclubhouse.com
rules: 1. Each player rolls one die at the same time.  2. The first person to say the difference of the two dice gets a point.  3. The first player to ten wins!
